intro: Cremosperma sylvaticum, commonly known as the wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its stems are often hairy, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Cremosperma sylvaticum is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
